page.title: 05UTTOXETER STREET MARKET
page.content: On Monday 15th May 1985, in Uttoxeter we asked stall holders questions.They bring their stalls to the market because there are vacancies and space for stalls, also stock sells well. Some said that they were not normally busy. Some would like better stalls, ground pavements. Having a market stall was a full time job for three quarters of the stall holders. They all said they took their stalls to market elsewhere such as Blackwell, Sutton in Ashfield and Warwick. All the stall holders we spoke to had been coming to the market for thirty to forty years. Wednesday is their favourite day. No stall had been passed down from one generation to the next. We spoke to shoppers. They like Wednesday morning best,especially cheaper crockery,fruit, and veg.
